item.description:
Join the Massachusetts Sierra Club and the MIT Recycling Working Group of Support Staff Issues (WGSSI) for their monthly (Friday nite) Energy Movie Nights. Movies are followed by a discussion.

Free and open to the public. These films and discussion series are on the issue of sustainability and the future, cosponsored by Progressive Neighbors. Sierra Club Contact: Blossom Hoag, blossomhoag@gmail.com, 617-821-4263.

"FLOW: For the Love of Water"
Friday, March 13, 2009, 6pm
MIT, Cambridge, Bldg 32-124
A documentary and a three-alarm warning, Flow dives into our planet's most essential resource and third-largest industry to find pollution, scarcity, human suffering and corporate profit. And that's just in the United States.
item.how_to_find_us: The organizer, Blossom Hoag, will have a nametag

group.name: Greater Boston Sierra Club Environmental Meetup Group

item.name: Energy Movie Nights at MIT: Flow: For the Love of Water
